intro: Triumfetta dekindtiana, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, hence its common name. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
